intro: Hypochaeris contexta, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces yellow flowers with a central disc. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Hypochaeris contexta is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
